1.0: And behold, a man came from the camp- There is [an opinion found] in Pesikta that this is Doeg, but it does not dwell on my heart (I disagree).

2.0: And his second was Kilav- And in a different place (Chronicles II, 3:1), it calls him Daniel, and so why was he called Kilav [here]? Rav Yitzchak said,
2.1: "It was on account of the scoffers of the generation, who said, 'Avigayil (Kilav's mom) was pregnant from Naval (her previous husband),' and so [G-d] changed his appearance and he resembled his father (David)." And our Rabbis said, "Because he embarassed Mephiboshet in law study (Berakhot 4a)"

0.0: At the time when Kings go out. There is a specific time of year when soldiers go out. This is when the land is filled with standing grain and the horses bring out produce in the field to eat.
